Without looking into details at all, I have chosen  
[MIT License](https://choosealicense.com/licenses/mit/) for the code and  
[Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 License](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/) for the text  

If you want to look at details, see [choosealicense.com][choose] for
help deciding.  
For details on the written content of the site, see [Creative Commons][cc].  

[choose]: http://choosealicense.com/
[cc]: https://creativecommons.org/choose/

It's a convention to save a file `CITATION` in the root of your Git repo that contains the citation information. I have not done this...
